alert.note: Alert for Attala; Carroll; Grenada; Holmes; Montgomery; Webster (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 3:31AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Holmes, Carroll, eastern Grenada, northwestern Attala, western Webster and Montgomery Counties through 415 AM CDT... At 330 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Gore Springs to near Duck Hill to near Carrollton to near Cruger. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Elliott, Duck Hill and Gore Springs around 335 AM CDT. Misterton and Black Hawk around 340 AM CDT. Winona, Lexington and Sweatman around 345 AM CDT. Vaiden, Lodi and Emory around 350 AM CDT. Bowling Green around 355 AM CDT. Durant, Kilmichael, West and Embry around 400 AM CDT. Walthall, Possumneck, Poplar Creek and Bellefontaine around 405 AM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees. If on or near Grenada Lake, get off of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Boats could be damaged or overturned in high winds and suddenly higher waves.

area.areaDesc: Attala; Carroll; Grenada; Holmes; Montgomery; Webster
